Sorted from most to least effective:
1. 'd' (Fix the mistakes) - Addressing the actual issue of shoddy work is the most effective response to prevent further problems in the project.
2. 'c' (Tell the project manager about the situation) - Alerting the project manager to the issue gives Max an opportunity to address the problem directly with the responsible individuals, thereby preventing recurrence.

4. 'a' (Forget about it) - Ignoring the problem may work in the short term, but it can lead to larger problems in the long run. It may also affect the overall quality of the project, causing Max to lose credibility.
